Main function.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Setting up \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{argparse}} to catch the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}debug}} flag on startup, running \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{setup\_logging()}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Logging setup for the program.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Logs are saved in a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{./logs/}} directory relative to the current working directory,
which will be created if it’s not present.
Logging config uses a ‘logging\_config.json’ file in this module’s directory.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}

Main interface of the program. Providing ways for the user to input information
that gets checked for to finally be able to fit a model to data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tkinter}} extension called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{customtkinter}} to achieve a modern look.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Interface for results created by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ModelFitter}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Provides a way to save results locally and view a plot of the residuals of the fit if possible.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{tkinter}} extension called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{customtkinter}} to achieve a modern look.

Stores the differences at each index in a dictionary with index:difference pairs.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {}

\end{itemize}

if there is only a single sub\sphinxhyphen{}list.

\sphinxAtStartPar

and return a list of tuples of floats.

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{read\_file() (in module src.FileHandler)@\spxentry{read\_file()}\spxextra{in module src.FileHandler}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{FileHandler:src.FileHandler.read_file}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.FileHandler.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{read\_file}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{file\_path}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{str}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ DataFrame}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Read a \sphinxtitleref{.csv} or \sphinxtitleref{.xlsx} file from the given path and return it as a \sphinxtitleref{pd.DataFrame}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Uses pathlib’s \sphinxtitleref{is\_file()} method to ensure there is a file at the given path.
Then tries to obtain the file’s suffix and checks for \sphinxtitleref{.csv} or \sphinxtitleref{.xlsx} formats,
for which the corresponding pandas read method is called.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_path}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} Path to the file to be read.

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{FileNotFoundError}} \textendash{} If no file exists at \sphinxtitleref{file\_path}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ValueError}} \textendash{} If \sphinxtitleref{file\_path} has no suffix.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{TypeError}} \textendash{} If the file is not either an Excel table or CSV file.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A \sphinxtitleref{pd.DataFrame} containing all information that is read from the excel or csv file.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
pd.DataFrame

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{write\_file() (in module src.FileHandler)@\spxentry{write\_file()}\spxextra{in module src.FileHandler}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

Write the provided \sphinxtitleref{pd.DataFrame} as either \sphinxtitleref{.xlsx} or \sphinxtitleref{.csv} to the \sphinxtitleref{./res/} directory.

\sphinxAtStartPar
If there is no \sphinxtitleref{./res/} directory relative to where the program was started from,
that directory will be created.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{file\_format}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{FileHandler:src.FileHandler.FileExtensions}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{FileExtensions}}}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Format of the written file, defaults to \sphinxtitleref{FileExtensions.EXCEL}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{create\_dataframe\_for() (src.ModelData.ModelData method)@\spxentry{create\_dataframe\_for()}\spxextra{src.ModelData.ModelData method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ModelData:src.ModelData.ModelData.create_dataframe_for}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{create\_dataframe\_for}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{format}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{FileHandler:src.FileHandler.FileExtensions}]{\sphinxcrossref{FileExtensions}}}}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{FileExtensions.EXCEL}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ DataFrame}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a \sphinxtitleref{pd.DataFrame} for the specified format, i.e. either Excel or CSV.
The DataFrame contains information about the user inputs into the program and what the program
made of those. It also contains the fit of the model if possible. If no fitted model string was
given, a warning will be logged and the field in the DataFrame will read ‘N/A’.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{format}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{FileHandler:src.FileHandler.FileExtensions}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{FileExtensions}}}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} The format for which the DataFrame is constructed. Defaults to FileExtensions.EXCEL.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A DataFrame containing all input and output information.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
pd.DataFrame

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\chapter{ModelFitter module}
\label{\detokenize{ModelFitter:module-src.ModelFitter}}\label{\detokenize{ModelFitter:modelfitter-module}}\label{\detokenize{ModelFitter::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!src.ModelFitter@\spxentry{src.ModelFitter}}\index{src.ModelFitter@\spxentry{src.ModelFitter}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This module provides functions to fit a model to data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The fitting routines are based on the assumption that the model is of type VPCModel
with provided data consisting of a list of lists where each sub\sphinxhyphen{}list is a column from a datasheet.
\index{check\_model\_is\_valid\_vector() (in module src.ModelFitter)@\spxentry{check\_model\_is\_valid\_vector()}\spxextra{in module src.ModelFitter}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ModelFitter:src.ModelFitter.check_model_is_valid_vector}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.ModelFitter.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{check\_model\_is\_valid\_vector}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{model}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{VPCModel:src.VPCModel.VPCModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{VPCModel}}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{columns}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{int}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bool}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Checks if the model is valid when comparing it the the sample data.

\sphinxAtStartPar
A model is an invalid if there are not enough columns in the data to account for all
independent variables and the result components.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{model}} ({\hyperref[\detokenize{VPCModel:src.VPCModel.VPCModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{VPCModel}}}}}) \textendash{} The model to be checked.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{columns}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} The number of columns in the provided data.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{Exception}} \textendash{} If there are too few or too many columns in the data.    Too few make it impossible to fit the model, too many make it ambiguous as to what the extra    columns are supposed to mean, or which columns are even to be regarded and which ones not.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Whether the model is a vector.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bool

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{evaluate\_fit() (in module src.ModelFitter)@\spxentry{evaluate\_fit()}\spxextra{in module src.ModelFitter}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{ModelFitter:src.ModelFitter.evaluate_fit}}
\pysigstartsignatures

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{src.ModelFitter.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{fit}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{model}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{{\hyperref[\detokenize{VPCModel:src.VPCModel.VPCModel}]{\sphinxcrossref{VPCModel}}}}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{data}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{list\DUrole{p}{{[}}list\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }float\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{extract\_symbols}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{sorting\_prio}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{n}{list\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{p}{|}\DUrole{w}{ }None}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{ }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ list\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Extract all unique symbols out of the model equations right\sphinxhyphen{}hand side.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Unique symbols are single or multi\sphinxhyphen{}character sequences consisting of letters.
If a sorting prio is given, the characters in it are returned at the front of the output,
the rest is ordered alphabetically.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sorting\_prio}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]} }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{| }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{None}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Characters to be placed at the start of the output , defaults to None

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All unique symbols in the expression on the right\sphinxhyphen{}hand of the equation.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
list{[}str{]}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
